result.execSummary:
The defendant Sabrina R Gholson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge; and pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/27/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and family or medical care.
****1021/2014, Judge Siefert; ORDER for defendant's release on ELECTRONIC MONITORING.***
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sabrina R Gholson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: /granting electronic monitoring release, signed and filed.  Copy sent to defendant and to the House of Correction.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47 (gun court successor), for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.

Defendant Sabrina R Gholson in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley. Marissa Santiago for Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 10 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and family or medical care.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/27/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/27/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored

Defendant Sabrina R Gholson in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. /SAB
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court advised that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/27/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Sabrina R Gholson in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Sabrina R Gholson in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Randy Sitzberger for Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Valerie T.

Defendant Sabrina R Gholson in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sabrina R Gholson
Current: 4821 N. 22nd Street Apt. 1307, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 03-06-2014)
Prior: 4918 West Hampton Avenue #6, Milwaukee, WI 53218
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3-6-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
